meanings.definition: To set or turn something upside down
meanings.sent1: She upended the bucket to empty its contents.
meanings.sent2: The chef upended the cake to decorate the bottom layer.
meanings.sent3: The magician upended the hat, but instead of a rabbit, a bunch of flowers fell out!
meanings.sent4: His decision to upend the traditional method brought unexpected results.
meanings.sent5: The tornado upending everything in its path was a terrifying sight.

meanings.sent1: The rebels planned to upend the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent2: The court ruling upended the previous verdict.
meanings.sent3: The students upended the classroom rules by starting a dance party.
meanings.sent4: Her speech upended the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist upended the entire story.

meanings.definition: To disrupt or change the usual order or arrangement
meanings.sent1: The new technology upended the traditional way of doing things.
meanings.sent2: The strike upended the company's production schedule.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy upended the neatly arranged shoes.
meanings.sent4: The arrival of the celebrity upended the quiet town.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm upending the picnic plans was disappointing.
